title: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS - SAGE YMCA Title: External Communications - Sage YMCA (Wallingford Board of Education)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS - SAGE YMCA Title: External Communications - Sage YMCA (Wallingford Board of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. § 1-200 et seq.), I respectfully request access to the following public records:

PRIMARY RECORDS REQUESTED:
- All communications between YMCA staff and Wallingford Public Schools personnel from January 1, 2024 to present
- Documentation of any complaints, incidents, or issues involving YMCA members or programs from January 1, 2024 to present
- Records of staff training regarding confidentiality, member privacy, and professional boundaries
- Any communications with legal counsel regarding member disputes or staff conduct issues from January 1, 2024 to present

COMPREHENSIVE DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS:
This request includes, but is not limited to:
- All responsive records regardless of format (paper, electronic, audio, video, social media, messaging apps)
- Records stored on personal devices if used for official business
- Records in possession of contractors, consultants, or third parties acting on behalf of the agency
- Draft documents, notes, calendars, and informal communications
- Records that have been deleted but remain recoverable
- Metadata and audit logs associated with electronic records

SEARCH REQUIREMENTS:
- Search all relevant custodians, not just those specifically named
- Search all email accounts, shared drives, and backup systems
- Include records of employees no longer with the agency
- Search alternative spellings, nicknames, and partial names

PRODUCTION STANDARDS:
- Provide records in native electronic format when possible
- Do not convert searchable documents to non-searchable formats
- Preserve all metadata including timestamps and sender/recipient information
- Provide a privilege log for any claimed exemptions

If any responsive records have been destroyed, please provide:
- Documentation of the destruction
- Reason for destruction
- Date of destruction
- Authority for destruction

If you claim any exemption under the Freedom of Information Act, please:
- Identify the specific statutory exemption
- Explain how the exemption applies to each document
- Provide redacted copies where partial disclosure is possible
- Consider whether public interest outweighs any claimed exemption

This request seeks records that serve the public interest in government transparency and accountability. Please construe all exemptions narrowly and err on the side of disclosure.

Please preserve all potentially responsive records immediately upon receipt of this request to prevent spoliation.

As these records serve significant public interest, please waive all fees. If fees cannot be waived, please provide detailed cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your assistance.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

john Conrad

title: blended

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: blended
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges: 

https://www.whqr.org/local/2025-05-09/wrightsboro-parent-pushing-for-book-ban-appeals-after-school-committee-rejects-their-challenge

Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “blended”, “dei”, "committee recommendation”, “administrative decision”, “determination letter”, “6th grade and up”, “policy 3200”, “policy 3210”, “privacy violation”, or “leak”. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discuss book bans B) any other document that has been used to help explain book bans, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “josie barnhart”, “charles foust”, “blended” or “sharon draper”; “dei”, “diversity”, “edi”, “wrightsboro elementary”, or “stamped: racism, antiracism, and you”

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning  “josie barnhart”, “charles foust”, “blended” or “sharon draper”; “dei”, “diversity”, “edi”, "committee recommendation”, “administrative decision”, “determination letter”, “6th grade and up”, “policy 3200”, “policy 3210”, “privacy violation”, “leak”, “wrightsboro elementary”, or “stamped: racism, antiracism, and you”

Please perform this search for records between April 1, 2025 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Summit Follow-Up
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The contracts/agreements the school district most recently entered into with their school bus operator/provider (Summit/Durham/National Express/Other).

Relating to bus operator agreements, please provide the entire contract, not just extensions or amendments, plus any provisions/amendments/appendixes related to the requirements for bus owners/operators to provide access to buses, especially related to third party vendors that the school districts contracts directly.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith

title: Boulder County Flock ALPR

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request #R000116-011526
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. ALPR Locations: Please provide the precise location of each Flock Safety ALPR camera deployed and utilized by Boulder County Sheriff's Office.
2. Email Communications with Flock Safety (specifically emails sent to and received from email addresses ending in “@flocksafety.com”): All metadata(from address, to address(es), cc address(es), bcc address(es), date/time sent, date/time received, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, only the specified metadata.) of email communications between Boulder County Sheriff's Office and Flock Safety between January 1, 2021 and the present.
3. Hotlist Criteria: Please provide documentation of policies detailing the criteria and procedures for creating and verifying entries on hotlists in Flock Safety's ALPR system. Specifically:
a. Criteria for adding entries to hotlists (e.g., offense types, jurisdictional warrants, etc.)
b. Verification and approval processes before hotlist alerts are actionable
4. Data-Sharing Agreements: List of all agencies with whom Boulder County Sheriff's Office shares ALPR data, both within Colorado and out-of-state, including federal entities.
5. Policies on ALPR Use and Oversight: Any formal policies or guidelines related to:
a. Acceptable and prohibited uses of ALPR data, including specific restrictions and permissible use cases
b. Access policy, including what constitutes a “valid reason” for system access
c. Human verification procedures for hotlist alerts before law enforcement action
6. Access Logs and Audits: Any access logs, audits, compliance reports, or oversight records evaluating the use, accuracy, and policy compliance of Boulder County Sheriff's Office ALPR systems between January 1, 2021 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Spratlin

communications.subject: Records Request :: R000116-011526
communications.communication:
Dear MATTHEW SPRATLIN: 
We appreciate your interest in criminal justice records of the Boulder County Sheriff’s Office. Your request was received on  1/15/2026 and will be processed according to the Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (CCJRA), C.R.S. 24-72-301 et seq., and other applicable laws. Disclosure of records involving children may be restricted by the Children’s Code Records and Information Act, C.R.S. 19-1-301 et seq. 
The Sheriff’s Office Records Section does not process requests for public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), C.R.S. 24-72-201 et seq. Requests for public records under CORA should be submitted to the Boulder County’s Open Records Center available at https://bouldercounty.gov/records/colorado-open-records-act/. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaWhAOeQS4p-2FTifjFiHmIBToUhCNwPrijCljaecY3mINRUTFikS2djaQyg-2FJ7hIZ8luPa63HTgmuk3H1tWjGbKI-3DQW5S_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFlM-2FT-2FZ7glL-2BBqYg9N4wYHZ8lWuxVeAa-2B7P3ulgRA8fuExOEDO32UGNLt8gJiNNi-2FTmlOXJMMM5C6bP7PaJw-2F7l8wABoXl3wkVYCMFqPMD8UbKoFrnP9oUF-2FgVIN352e055NnrnUqbc7SpPbnSvla8Q-3D) 
You will receive an email when the response to your request is ready. While the Records Section is working diligently to respond, please note that the 3-day timeframe for inspection under CORA does not apply to requests for criminal justice records under the CCJRA. This request can be tracked at the link below using assigned reference number R000116-011526. 
The Sheriff’s Office also publishes certain criminal justice information online, including daily booking and listing reports for the Boulder County Jail, available at: https://bouldercounty.gov/safety/jail/listing-and-booking-reports/. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaWhAOeQS4p-2FTifjFiHmIBT2MJBJQmvdwUDiv0zYVq10kivwqXhRz5ZRo0NzoQrJNkh6yFBa-2FP7KQLm7eFSs948-3DpP8T_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFmKLNulZn-2FRuB2-2FuXNkTTOzLJFJlIucpmrnUfewSM76Sk5iGKQX7kfEvKZzeodUz-2B28lQGCUaemLEQi91br7cP1GeS8gScJHiYoQgC9C-2FbVNq9vqZJ2XXtctyOajwSoXHsSeZs8Sfzf9ox88G5zqe3A-3D)

communications.subject: CORA Request :: C000035-012126
communications.communication:
Dear Matthew Spratlin: 
Thank you for your interest in the public information of Boulder County. Your request was received on 1/21/2026 and given the reference number C000035-012126 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. ALPR Locations: Please provide the precise location of each Flock Safety ALPR camera deployed and utilized by Boulder County Sheriff's Office. 
2. Email Communications with Flock Safety (specifically emails sent to and received from email addresses ending in “@flocksafety.com”): All metadata(from address, to address(es), cc address(es), bcc address(es), date/time sent, date/time received, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, only the specified metadata.) of email communications between Boulder County Sheriff's Office and Flock Safety between January 1, 2021 and the present. 
3. Hotlist Criteria: Please provide documentation of policies detailing the criteria and procedures for creating and verifying entries on hotlists in Flock Safety's ALPR system. Specifically: 
a. Criteria for adding entries to hotlists (e.g., offense types, jurisdictional warrants, etc.) 
b. Verification and approval processes before hotlist alerts are actionable 
4. Data-Sharing Agreements: List of all agencies with whom Boulder County Sheriff's Office shares ALPR data, both within Colorado and out-of-state, including federal entities. 
5. Policies on ALPR Use and Oversight: Any formal policies or guidelines related to: 
a. Acceptable and prohibited uses of ALPR data, including specific restrictions and permissible use cases 
b. Access policy, including what constitutes a “valid reason” for system access 
c. Human verification procedures for hotlist alerts before law enforcement action 
6. Access Logs and Audits: Any access logs, audits, compliance reports, or oversight records evaluating the use, accuracy, and policy compliance of Boulder County Sheriff's Office ALPR systems between January 1, 2021 and the present. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Matthew Spratlin 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2179756/ 
You will be contacted about the availability of records and/or provided with copies of the records. Depending on the scope of your request, a deposit and/or extension may be requested. If a deposit and/or extension is needed, Boulder County will contact you with an estimate before proceeding. All communications will be through the Boulder County Records Center. PLEASE NOTE: The Colorado Open Records Act (CORA) does not require Boulder County to create new records, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request under " My Requests" in the Boulder County Open Records Center.

title: Watsonville - Airport Blvd

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Watsonville - Airport Blvd
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am stating the purpose of this request so that you may assist me as required by California Government Code (“Gov”) § 7922.600(a)(1). The purpose of this California Public Records Act request is to determine the existence or non-existence of a specific record. 

Please note that I am not requesting the record itself, only confirmation of its existence or non-existence. Thus, Civil Code § 1798.90.55, law enforcement exemptions, the public interest exemption or any other laws or exemptions do not apply to, and are not relevant to, this request. 

Please confirm the existence or non-existence of the following Flock Safety ALPR footage record:

License Plate: 9SYY133
Date: January 20, 2026
Time Frame: 12:05 PM - 12:15 PM
Camera Location: Airport Blvd in front of Watsonville Community Hospital
Camera Lat/long: 36.927511866270144, -121.79515700003752

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Moore

communications.subject: Your City of Watsonville, CA public records request #26-53 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Watsonville, CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #26-53 has been submitted successfully. Dear Requester:  The City of Watsonville ("City") is in receipt of the Public Records Act request you submitted. The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act ("PRA") (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.) Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for information, that information is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the information is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request. Within the next ten (10) days, we will determine whether your request seeks copies of disclosable records in the City's possession or whether the City will require an extension. Sincerely,   City Clerk's Office (831) 768-3048 275 Main Street, Suite 400, Watsonville, CA 95076 FAX: 831-761-0736 E-mail:  cityclerk@watsonville.gov Open Monday - Friday 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Watsonville, CA.

communications.communication:
City of Watsonville, CA ************************************************************************ Record request #26-53 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear David Moore, The City of Watsonville (“City”) is in receipt of the Public Records Act request you submitted, received on January 26, 2026 (“Request”). The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act (“PRA”). (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.) Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for the record, that record is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the record is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions, requests for information, or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request. the City has determined that it possesses records responsive to your Request. However, the City is withholding the responsive records pursuant to California Civil Code section 1798.90.55(b). (See also Cal. Gov. Code § 7927.705.). With this letter and production, the City considers this Request complete. title: Beckley City WV Opioid Settlement Funds Spring 2026

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Beckley City WV Opioid Settlement Funds Spring 2026
communications.communication:
Jessica Riley 
1511 University Avenue, P.O. Box 6010
Morgantown, WV 26506-6010
January 23, 2026 

Angela King
Grant Administrator
The City of Beckley
409 S Kanawha St Beckley, WV 25801
aking@beckley.org

Dear Angela King:
Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to Beckley’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting: 
- Documentation of the amount of funds the city has received from the federal opioid lawsuit settlements
- The application forms that any organization would submit to receive settlement funds
- Documentation of how much city-level funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded
- Any completed application of an organization that has received settlement funds from the city
- Documentation of the process by which funds are awarded
- Any documents that contain the names of the individuals who review the funding applications and determine the awards
- Any documents that account for future plans from the city for the use of opioid settlement funds
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how the opioid settlement funds are being spent. I am a student journalist whose request is strictly for news-gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 
Thank you for considering my request. 
Sincerely, Jessica Riley 
330-978-8228
jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu

title: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any notes, slideshows, visual displays, handout materials, or recording (including video, audio, or written transcript) made by staff (excluding any employee with an academic or faculty appointment) or administrators with any meeting with department chairs or faculty concerning or mentioning gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

2. Any policy or written guidance concerning gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

3. Any instructions to faculty or department chairs concerning any review of courses, course material, or syllabi as that review pertains to gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

These requests are limited to records generated on or after September 1, 2025. Please note that these requests do not seek a search of any faculty, student, faculty organization, or student organization records, and no such search should be conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Re: [External] RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thanks for your reminder. You haven't received a proper response to your inquiry because of a mistake on my part. Apparently on October 21, 2025 I replied back to you instead of forwarding your request to our public information officer, so your request was never routed properly. I apologize for my mistake and the delay in our institution's response. Your request is now being seen by the people who need to see it and the college is now working on it.

Thank you,

Andrew Myers

Data Analyst

3110 Mustang Road, Alvin, Texas 77511

281.756.3668 | www.alvincollege.edu<https://www.alvincollege.edu/>
